user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_get_rq_bauth_params_:
```c
const struct MHD_RqBAuth *
MHD_get_rq_bauth_params_ (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  struct _MHD_str_w_len h_auth_value;
  struct MHD_RqBAuth *bauth;

  mhd_assert (MHD_CONNECTION_HEADERS_PROCESSED <= connection->state);

  if (connection->rq.bauth_tried)
    return connection->rq.bauth;

  if (MHD_CONNECTION_HEADERS_PROCESSED > connection->state)
    return NULL;

  if (! find_auth_rq_header_ (connection, MHD_AUTHTYPE_BASIC, &h_auth_value))
  {
    connection->rq.bauth_tried = true;
    connection->rq.bauth = NULL;
    return NULL;
  }

  bauth =
    (struct MHD_RqBAuth *)
    MHD_connection_alloc_memory_ (connection, sizeof (struct MHD_RqBAuth));

  if (NULL == bauth)
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
              _ ("Not enough memory in the connection's pool to allocate " \
                 "for Basic Authorization header parsing.\n"));
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */
    return NULL;
  }

  memset (bauth, 0, sizeof(struct MHD_RqBAuth));
  if (parse_bauth_params (h_auth_value.str, h_auth_value.len, bauth))
    connection->rq.bauth = bauth;
  else
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
              _ ("The Basic Authorization client's header has "
                 "incorrect format.\n"));
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */
    connection->rq.bauth = NULL;
    /* Memory in the pool remains allocated until next request */
  }
  connection->rq.bauth_tried = true;
  return connection->rq.bauth;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
              _ ("The Basic Authorization client's header has "
                 "incorrect format.\n"));
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */

#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
              _ ("Not enough memory in the connection's pool to allocate " \
                 "for Basic Authorization header parsing.\n"));
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */
explanation: Other parts of this function do not exhibit obvious unreachable-code patterns and therefore need not be investigated for Rule 2.1: the early-return on connection->rq.bauth_tried is a reachable guard; the call to find_auth_rq_header_ and its false branch (setting tried flag and returning) are valid, reachable error-handling paths; the allocation, NULL check, memset, parse_bauth_params success/failure branches and the final updates to connection->rq.bauth and connection->rq.bauth_tried are standard, reachable control flow. There are no infinite loops, constant-false/true conditional expressions (aside from the items listed), or statements following unconditional returns (other than normal function flow) elsewhere in the function. Therefore only the listed fragments warrant further investigation for potential unreachable code.
